item.title: Lilith add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself. A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough without ever having felt sorry for itself." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I would believe only in a God that knows how to dance." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In Christianity neither morality nor religion come into contact with reality at any point." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "All photographs are memento mori. To take a photograph is to participate in another person’s (or thing’s) mortality, vulnerability, mutability. Precisely by slicing out this moment and freezing it, all photographs testify to time’s relentless melt." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "One's own free and unfettered volition, one's own caprice, however wild, one's own fancy, inflamed sometimes to the point of madness - that is the one best and greatest good, which is never taken into consideration because it cannot fit into any classification and the omission of which sends all systems and theories to the devil." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Amor Fati – “Love Your Fate”, which is in fact your life." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Every now and then when your life gets complicated and the weasels start closing in, the only cure is to load up on heinous chemicals and then drive like a bastard from Hollywood to Las Vegas ... with the music at top volume and at least a pint of ether." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Lilith add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood." -- George Orwell

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Lilith add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde
